page_analysis.text_content:
Fig 4 Types of porches and entry ways

A Roofed porch

B Roofed entry way
(not vaulted)

C Vaulted entry way

D Combination porch & vaulted entry way

See how to measure height of porches & entry features in Figs 6-8 on pp. 11-13

Height less than 12" above grade (for B)
Height greater than 12" above grade (for C and D)

visual_elements.description: Four architectural line drawings illustrating different types of porches and entry ways: (A) Roofed porch showing a single-story porch with a roof supported by columns and a door; (B) Roofed entry way (not vaulted) showing a house front with a small roofed entry door with height less than 12 inches above grade; (C) Vaulted entry way showing a house front with a vaulted entry door with height greater than 12 inches above grade; (D) Combination porch & vaulted entry way showing a porch with arches and a vaulted entry door with height greater than 12 inches above grade. Each drawing includes a vertical measurement line indicating height relative to grade with annotations specifying "less than 12" above grade" or "greater than 12" above grade" as applicable.
visual_elements.location: Full page, with A and C on the top half, B and D on the bottom half

visual_elements.description: A grey shaded box containing the text: "See how to measure height of porches & entry features in Figs 6-8 on pp. 11-13"
visual_elements.location: Center of the page, between the top and bottom drawings

technical_specifications.parameter: Height of porch or entry way above grade
Height of porch or entry way above grade

structural_elements.main_heading: Fig 4 Types of porches and entry ways

additional_notes: No handwritten annotations, stamps, or markings present.
Page number appears as a small '/1' in bottom right corner.
Text and drawings are clear and legible.
cross_references: See how to measure height of porches & entry features in Figs 6-8 on pp. 11-13
